00010 // constant macros are not usually used with C++ so the standard mechanism to
00011 // activate it is to define before stdint.h
00012 #ifndef __STDC_CONSTANT_MACROS
00013 #   define __STDC_CONSTANT_MACROS
00014 #endif
00015 
00016 // format macros are not usually used with C++ so the standard mechanism to
00017 // activate it is to define before inttypes.h
00018 #ifndef __STDC_FORMAT_MACROS
00019 #   define __STDC_FORMAT_MACROS
00020 #endif

00025 #       define _FILE_OFFSET_BITS 64
00026 #   endif
00027 #endif

00072 #define MP4V2_PATH_MAX PATH_MAX
00073 
00075 
00076 // win32 platform requires O_BINARY when using old open() calls so we add
00077 // this harmless bit-flag for posix to avoid .cpp platform conditionals
00078 #ifndef O_BINARY
00079 #   define O_BINARY  0
00080 #endif
00081 
00083 
00084 // ARM seems to require integer instructions operands to have 4-byte alignment
00085 // so we set this macro to for some int<->string code to manually copy string
00086 // bytes into an int which aligns it. This is much easier than trying to
00087 // align pertinent string data (constants) from in text sections.
00088 #if defined( __arm__ )
00089 #   define MP4V2_INTSTRING_ALIGNMENT 1
00090 #else
00091 #   undef MP4V2_INTSTRING_ALIGNMENT
00092 #endif
00093 
00095 
00096 #endif // MP4V2_PLATFORM_POSIX_H
